intro: Schultesia brachyptera, commonly known as the short-winged schultesia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with five petals and a distinctive, short corona. Its leaves are opposite and oval-shaped, often covered in fine hairs. Schultesia brachyptera is typically found in rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
